page.title: 08BROAD POOL
page.content: AT THE FOOT OF CEFN BRYN AND NEAR THE HAMLET OF CILIBION IS BROAD POOL,A STRETCH OF FRESH WATER APPROX 3 ACRES IN AREA,MADE POSSIBLE BY GLACIAL BOULDER CLAY DISOLVING INTO THE CAVERNS OF THE UNDERLYING LIMESTONE.THE POOL IS APPROX 1 METRE DEEP AND INHABITANTS INCLUDE RUDD,STICKLEBACKS AND AMPHIBIOUS CREATURES.IT WAS THE FIRST NATURE RESERVE TO BE ESTABLISHED BY THE GLAMORGAN NATURALISTS TRUST IN 1962 DUE TO THE RICH PLANT,INSECT AND BIRD LIFE.AS A RESULT OF THE RAPID GROWTH OF THE WATER LILY THE POND WAS DRAINED IN 1984 AND THE LILY REMOVED.THE POND HAS NOW REFILLED.
